gov.nih.nci.hl7.ui.map
Class PseudoRootTreeNode

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode
      gov.nih.nci.hl7.ui.tree.DefaultMappableTreeNode
          gov.nih.nci.hl7.ui.map.PseudoRootTreeNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
MappableNode, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, javax.swing.tree.MutableTreeNode, javax.swing.tree.TreeNode
public class PseudoRootTreeNode
extends DefaultMappableTreeNode

This class defines a pseudo root tree node as the place holder to indicate the type of tree. The instance of this class is simply a UI class. It does not participate in any drag-and-drop or other business logic related actions.

Version:
Since caAdapter v1.2 revision $Revision: 1.1 $ date $Date: 2006-10-03 17:36:24 $
Author:
OWNER: Scott Jiang, LAST UPDATE $Author: marwahah $
See Also:

Constructor Summary
PseudoRootTreeNode()
          Creates a tree node that has no parent and no children, but which allows children.
PseudoRootTreeNode(java.lang.Object userObject)

PseudoRootTreeNode(java.lang.Object userObject, boolean allowsChildren)
          Creates a tree node with no parent, no children, initialized with the specified user object, and that allows children only if specified.

Field Detail

RCSID

public static java.lang.String RCSID
String that identifies the class version and solves the serial version UID problem. This String is for informational purposes only and MUST not be made final.

See Also:
JBuilder vice javac serial version UID
Constructor Detail

PseudoRootTreeNode

public PseudoRootTreeNode()
Creates a tree node that has no parent and no children, but which allows children.

PseudoRootTreeNode

public PseudoRootTreeNode(java.lang.Object userObject)
Creates a tree node with no parent, no children, but which allows children, and initializes it with the specified user object.

Parameters:
userObject - an Object provided by the user that constitutes the node's data

PseudoRootTreeNode

public PseudoRootTreeNode(java.lang.Object userObject,
                          boolean allowsChildren)
Creates a tree node with no parent, no children, initialized with the specified user object, and that allows children only if specified.

Parameters:
userObject - an Object provided by the user that constitutes the node's data
allowsChildren - if true, the node is allowed to have child nodes -- otherwise, it is always a leaf node
